title: French elections: Far right surges in first round, left comes second ahead of Macron's camp
summary: According to initial estimates, the Rassemblement National and its allies got more than a third of the votes, while the left-wing Nouveau Front Populaire alliance bested President Emmanuel Macron's coalition.

title: Macron's coalition further weakened after first round of snap elections
summary: The Rassemblement National and its far-right allies won 34% of the votes, the left-wing Nouveau Front Populaire 28.1% and the presidential coalition 20.3%, according to initial estimates.

title: French elections: Swiftly united left comes out strengthened
summary: The coalition of left-wing parties garnered 28.1% of the vote, behind the Rassemblement National and its allies but ahead of President Emmanuel Macron's coalition.

title: French elections: First-round takeaways
summary: The far-right Rassemblement National made huge gains, Macron lost his gamble and the shape of the future Assemblée Nationale is still unknown.

title: French elections: Contested right-wing leader Ciotti well ahead after first round
summary: After striking a deal with the far-right Rassemblement National, the contested president of Les Républicains was well ahead of his rivals with 41.04% of the vote. He surpassed LR candidate Virgile Vanier-Guérin (5.78%), Horizons' Graig Monetti (22.79%), and Nouveau Front Populaire's Olivier Salerno (26.62%).

title: French elections: Prime Minister Attal likely to retain seat after strong first-round showing
summary: Gabriel Attal came out on top in the 10th constituency of Hauts-de-Seine, west of Paris, in the first round of the legislative elections.

title: French elections: Far-right Rassemblement National confirms dominance despite wavering promises
summary: The party led by Jordan Bardella and his allies won 33.2% of the vote, ahead of the Nouveau Front Populaire and the presidential coalition, according to initial national estimates. Never before had the far-right party broken the 20% barrier in a parliamentary election.

title: French elections: Why seat projections after the first round might not be reliable
summary: In the past, polling institutes' national estimates of voting percentages have proved fairly reliable. Here, we explain why, in the June 30 vote, these figures will not be enough to know what the Assemblée Nationale will look like after the votes are counted.

title: 'Not French enough? It doesn't make sense': Dual nationals upset by the far right's policy platform
summary: They are scientists, doctors, real estate managers... and they have dual nationality. Speaking with Le Monde, they share a deep sense of injustice and their concerns for France.

title: Euro 2024: Spain beats Georgia 4-1 to advance to quarterfinals
summary: Spain will now play host nation Germany in the quarterfinals on Friday, July 5, in Stuttgart.

title: South Africa announces new government with opposition getting 12 ministries
summary: President Cyril Ramaphosa announced his new government on Sunday following tough coalition negotiations after the ruling ANC lost its outright parliamentary majority. The largest coalition partner, the Democratic Alliance, will hold six portfolios including home affairs, environment and public works.

title: Jill Biden, a highly political first lady and protector of the American president
summary: The wife of the White House occupant, who had encouraged him to run for a second term, was quick to come to his defense after his disastrous debate with Donald Trump.

title: Tour de France 2024: Pogacar takes overall lead on stage two
summary: The second stage in Italy was won by French rider Kevin Vauguelin, but Tadej Pogacar gained enough time to claim the yellow jersey.

title: Hungary's Orban takes over Council of the European Union presidency for six months
summary: Starting July 1, Hungary will assume the rotating presidency of the Council, during a period of transition for both the Parliament in Strasbourg and the Commission.

title: Paris 2024: The horse reigns supreme in Versailles
summary: As the host town for the equestrian events, Versailles has turned its routine upside down to successfully transform into an Olympic city and welcome the tens of thousands of spectators expected in and around the beloved château.

title: In Slovenia, in the slipstream of Tadej Pogacar and Primoz Roglic, cycling has become king
summary: In Slovenia, the two riders, hoping for victory in the Tour de France 2024, have elevated cycling to the status of national sport. With the race now on day two after launching in Italy on Saturday, the craze is stronger than ever.

title: Deadly storms rage across France, Switzerland and Italy, leaving at least seven dead
summary: The Rhone river burst its banks on Sunday in several areas of Valais canton, flooding a highway and a railway line. The poor weather was making rescue work particularly difficult, police said earlier, with several valleys inaccessible.

title: 'The flagship of French anti-doping': The Saclay laboratory gets ready for the Paris Olympics
summary: 'Le Monde' gained access to the laboratory that will be responsible for analyzing all 8,000 samples taken during the Olympic and Paralympic Games.

title: The new life of Bilal, a former exploited minor: 'The guy who hurt me is free? It's not fair'
summary: It's been two years since, Bilal, 20, was extricated from Paris to try to start a new life in the south of France. The young Algerian had been exploited by two adults who drugged him to force him to steal. An organization managed to rescue him.

title: French elections: Strong mobilization with voters wanting 'change and order' or 'to block' the far right
summary: The turnout is expected to be much higher than in previous elections and can be explained as much by 'fear of what might happen tonight' as by a desire for change.

title: French election: Map of the first round's results
summary: View the results in each of the 577 constituencies of the Assemblée Nationale. Our map will update live as results are counted.

title: Paris 2024: Former pole vault world record holder Renaud Lavillenie to miss Olympics
summary: The 2012 Olympic champion failed to achieve the qualifying height to compete at this summer's Games, which would have been his last.

title: French elections: In Val-d'Oise, it's France against France
summary: In the 9th constituency of this department west of Paris, working-class neighborhoods and rural communities voted at opposite ends of the spectrum. The second round will pit the incumbent radical-left La France Insoumise MP against the far right's candidate.

title: Between Mexico and Texas, the despair of migrants dependent on the US election
summary: The area occupied by illegal immigrants seeking to reach the US illegally has been emptying since June 4, when Joe Biden issued an executive order to close the border in the event of an influx. This decision has caused distress among the exiles who hang on to the ups and downs of American politics.

title: French elections: Socialist leader re-elected in first round
summary: Olivier Faure, the head of the Parti Socialiste, claimed victory as early as the first round of voting on Sunday night.

title: Marine Le Pen retains seat in first round of snap elections
summary: The far-right leader said on Sunday she was re-elected in her constituency in northern France.

title: Former president François Hollande qualifies for second round of snap elections
summary: The former president topped the vote as he looks to make a comeback in his old constituency, according to near-complete results.

title: Our five favorite half-and-half pizzas in Marseille
summary: With Emmental cheese and anchovy, the specialty half-and-half pizza is very popular throughout the Southern city. In a Calanques restaurant or a pizzeria in the Panier neighborhood, sitting by a food truck or perched on a rock, here are five spots where you can treat yourself to an iconic 'moit-moit.'

title: French snap elections gate-crash summer festivals
summary: The organization of performances due to take place during the elections on June 30 and July 7 has been disrupted, in what promises to be a tense climate.

title: Macron's coalition split over how to block far right
summary: Prime Minister Gabriel Attal said there was a 'moral duty' to prevent the far-right Rassemblement National from having an absolute majority, suggesting the presidential coalition's third-placed candidates should withdraw. Some in Macron's camp don't agree.

title: 'Macron's brutal dissolution of the Assemblée resulted in the dissolution of his majority'
summary: By deciding to call early elections, the French president caused the destruction of his own majority and, therefore, his own weakening for the next three years, writes Le Monde's Solenn de Royer.

title: Euro and Paris stocks rise after French snap election first round
summary: At the start of trading on Monday, July 1, after a snap French legislative election that saw the far right surge, yet which allayed fears of their absolute majority of MPs, both the euro and France's CAC 40 index rose.

title: Air France says Olympics cut summer tourists to Paris
summary: The airline warned on Monday that there was evidence of 'a significance avoidance of Paris' and that many French were also postponing their holidays.

title: Acclaimed Albanian writer Ismail Kadare dies aged 88
summary: He was often tipped to win a Nobel prize for his towering body of work which delved into his country's myths and history to dissect the mechanisms of totalitarianism.

title: Simone Biles seals Paris Olympics spot: 'I'm so glad that I never gave up'
summary: The 27-year-old US gymnast secured an automatic place for Paris 2024 Games in Minnesota on Sunday, it will be her third Olympics.

title: French elections: Mixed feelings for left-wing alliance
summary: Having come second in the first round, the left-wing alliance Nouveau Front Populaire goes into the second round united, and ready to support the rival candidates if it means beating the far-right Rassemblement National. But the lack of reciprocity from the right and Macron's camp weakens it.

title: French elections: Far right, euphoric at historic score, verges on seizing power
summary: Far-right leader Jordan Bardella confirmed that he would only accept being named prime minister if he obtains an absolute majority at the Assemblée Nationale. Yet both he and Marine Le Pen know they will need to rally beyond their ranks.

title: Two French filmmakers held for questioning over sexual abuse allegations
summary: Benoît Jacquot et Jacques Doillon, accused of sexual abuse by actors including Judith Godrèche, were held in police custody for questioning.

title: Ismail Kadare, the great Albanian writer, dies aged 88
summary: He was one of the few Albanian authors known and translated worldwide. He died on Monday in Tirana.

title: Mauritania's President Ghazouani set to be re-elected
summary: Mauritanians went to the polls on Saturday to choose between seven presidential candidates, with the country's Independent National Electoral Commission predicting a victory for President Mohamed Ould Ghazouani, with over 56% of the vote.

title: Caribbean countries brace for powerful Hurricane Beryl
summary: Hurricane Beryl, a Category 3 storm that formed early in the June-November Atlantic hurricane season, has been sighted about 175 kilometers southeast of Barbados, which is one of the many Caribbean island nations preparing for the storm's passage.
